page.title: 15 DAILY LIFE: A MILKMAN
page.content: The milkman starts work at about 4.30 a.m. First he loads up the float. It is powered by battery so it is quiet as it goes round the streets. At the dairy he loads crates of bottles onto the float, then he starts his round. He drives the float to the street, then puts the milk bottles on people's doorsteps. He has an order book which tells him how many pints of milk to deliver. He also sells cream, bread, yoghurt and fruit juice. On Fridays and Saturdays he collects money from his customers. In the week he stops work at about 1.30 p.m. Back at the dairy he unloads the empty bottles that he picked up when he left the full ones. The float has to be charged up again ready for the next day. The job is well paid, but hard in winter.
